page.title: 07EDUCATION
page.content: EDUCATION IN NORTHWICH CATERS FOR ALL AGES,FROM THE NURSERY TO ADULTHOOD, AND IT TAKES PLACE IN A VARIETY OF INSTITUTIONS.THERE ARE NURSERIES WHICH ARE ATTACHED TO SCHOOLS AND OTHERS WHICH HAVE BEEN FORMED BY THE PARENTS OF THE CHILDREN WHO ATTEND. A TWO-TIER SYSTEM OF PRIMARY AND SECONDARY SCHOOLS PROVIDE PUPILS UP TO THE AGE OF SIXTEEN WITH THEIR EDUCATION,AFTER WHICH TIME THEY CAN EITHER LEAVE OR CONTINUE THEIR STUDIES AT A SIXTH-FORM COLLEGE OR A COLLEGE OF FURTHER EDUCATION. THE COLLEGES OF EDUCATION ALSO SERVE AS ADULT EDUCATION CENTRES AND PROVIDE A RANGE OF COURSES FROM LANGUAGES TO CAR MAINTAINENCE.THERE ARE A NUMBER OF SPECIAL SCHOOLS IN THE AREA WHICH CATER FOR DIFFERENT FORMS OF HANDICAP. THE NEAREST UNIVERSITIES ARE AT LIVERPOOL AND MANCHESTER.
